metadata.title: Thursday, 27th September, 2012
metadata.session: SECOND SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Health when the Government will construct a district hospital in the newly created Nsama District considering that the nearest hospital is in Mporokoso which is 100km away.
Minister of Agriculture and Livestock
parts: (a)    whether the Ministry has made any improvements to the Farmer Input Support Programme (FISP);
(b)    if so, what the improvements are;
(c)    what the criteria for identifying beneficiaries are; and
(d)    how much money was spent on the FISP from 2011 to 2012, year by year.

questions.minister: Minister of Home Affairs
parts: (a)    what measures the Government has taken to control the movement of inmates at Nyango Open Prison in Mangango Parliamentary Constituency to ensure the safety of the local community; and
(b)    when Nyango Open Prison will become a training centre for prison warders.

questions.minister: Minister of Lands, Natural Resources and Environmental Protection whether the Government allows the export of unprocessed timber.
Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a)    what the maternal mortality rate was in Zambia as of August, 2012;
(b)    what measures the Government has taken to reduce the mortality rate; and
(c)    whether the Government will attain the Millennium Development Goal No. 5, by 2015, which seeks to reduce the maternal mortality rate by 75 percent.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing when the Government will rehabilitate roads in Kabompo Township.
Minister of Agriculture and Livestock
parts: (a)    how many tonnes of maize are earmarked for purchase by the Food Reserve Agency (FRA) during the 2011/2012 marketing season;
(b)    what the total cost of the maize at (a) is; and
(c)    what the time-frame for payment of the farmers after delivery of their maize to FRA is.

questions.minister: Minister of Health whether the Ministry has plans to introduce direct entry in the following medical training programmes and, if so, when the plans will be implemented
parts: (a)    medical licentiate; and
(b)    mid-wifery.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education why payment of the Rural Hardship Allowance to teachers in Chilubi is always delayed and sometimes not paid at all.
Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    why the Government has not been providing grants to schools in Kalabo from 2010 to-date; and
(b)    when the provision of grants will resume.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    how much money was owed to ZESCO Limited by various Government ministries and departments in electricity bills from October, 2011 to February, 2012, month by month; and
(b)    what measures the Government has taken to clear the bills.

questions.minister: Minister of Health who the suppliers
questions.question_text: of medical equipment and drugs to Government hospitals and health centres are.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    how many canals in Lukulu West Parliamentary Constituency were rehabilitated in 2011;
(b)    what the total cost of the rehabilitation was; and
(c)    whether the Government has any plans to rehabilitate the following canals in 2012:
(i)    Kashizhi; (ii)    Chinonwe; and (iii)    Lutembwe.

questions.minister: Minister of Gender and Child Development what measures the Government has taken to reduce incidences of Gender-Based Violence.
Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    how many pontoons were operational at the Kazungula ferry point as of 30th April, 2012; and
(b)    who the owners of the pontoons were.

questions.minister: Minister of Health
parts: (a)    when the construction of a new district hospital at Munyumbwe, in Gwembe District will commence;
(b)    what the estimated cost of constructing the hospital is;
(c)    who the contractor is; and
(d)    what the time-frame for completion of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when construction of Taferansoni School in Chadiza Parliamentary Constituency will commence; and
(b)    what the estimated cost of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Health
parts: (a)    when the mortuary at Mulobezi Health Centre will be rehabilitated; and
(b)    how much money the exercise will require.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education when the office of the District Education Board Secretary will be opened in Mulobezi District.
Minister of Home Affairs when the construction of the police post in Lufwanyama District will be completed and opened to the public.
questions.question_text: ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Thanks - His Excellency the President’s Address – Motion (25th September) - Resumption of Debate.
